com.google.enterprise.connector.util

Class BasicChecksumGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.enterprise.connector.util.BasicChecksumGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChecksumGenerator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Base64ChecksumGenerator

    public class BasicChecksumGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ChecksumGenerator
    An implementation of ChecksumGenerator that return hexadecimal-encoded checksums using algorithms from java.security.MessageDigest.
    Since:
    2.8
    See Also:
    MessageDigest

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String MD2
      The MD2 message digest algorithm as defined in RFC 1319.
      static java.lang.String MD5
      The MD5 message digest algorithm as defined in RFC 1321.
      static java.lang.String SHA1
      The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-1.
      static java.lang.String SHA256
      The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-2.
      static java.lang.String SHA384
      The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-2.
      static java.lang.String SHA512
      The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-2.

    • Constructor Summary

      BasicChecksumGenerator(java.lang.String algorithm)
      Constructs a BasicChecksumGenerator that uses the specified message digest algorithm.

      • SHA256

        public static final java.lang.String SHA256
        The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-2. SHA-256 is a 256-bit hash function intended to provide 128 bits of security against collision attacks.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHA384

        public static final java.lang.String SHA384
        The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-2. A 384-bit hash may be obtained by truncating the SHA-512 output.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHA512

        public static final java.lang.String SHA512
        The Secure Hash Algorithm, as defined in NIST FIPS 180-2. SHA-512 is a 512-bit hash function intended to provide 256 bits of security.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicChecksumGenerator

        public BasicChecksumGenerator(java.lang.String algorithm)
        Constructs a BasicChecksumGenerator that uses the specified message digest algorithm. The supported algorithms are: "MD2", "MD5", "SHA-1", "SHA-256", "SHA-384", and "SHA-512"
        Parameters:
        algorithm - message digest algorithm
